resources.string: Notifies you about Wifi internet connectivity

Inetify notifies you about the status of internet connectivity when your device connects to a Wifi network. 

This can be useful if you have set up your device to automatically connect to a Wifi network that requires authentication on a web page ("captive portal"). 
In case you forget to authenticate, Inetify notifies you that there is no internet connectivity. 

Besides the notification icon, Inetify can play a notification tone of your choice and/or flash the notification light. 

How does it work? 

Inetify compares the title of the internet site set in the settings, by default "www.google.com", with the title specified in the settings, by default "Google". If the site cannot be reached at all or if the connection is forced to a captive portal, which most likely has a different title, internet connectivity is considered "Not OK" and a negative notification is given. 
If the title matches, internet connectivity is considered "OK" and a positive notification is given. 

In case the title of the internet site set in the settings changes, Inetify will give false negative notifications. If this happens, please check the title of the page and update the settings, or use another internet site which is unlikely to change its title. 
It is enough to specify a part of the title, and the comparison is case-insensitive. 

On the main view, you can test internet connectivity manually. Please note, that this will download data and thus can cause costs when using a mobile data connection! 
Inetify test internet connectivity only when a Wifi connection was established. 

For further information please go to 
http://code.google.com/p/inetify/ 

Thank you for trying out Inetify!
All or a part of the page title that the internet site is expected to have
